Java Class Documentation for xtc

xtc is a framework for building extensible source-to-source translators and compilers.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
xtc
xtc-wide constants.
xtc.lang
Language-specific support for C and Java.
xtc.lang.blink
A debugger contributed to xtc that integrates Java with C.
xtc.lang.blink.agent  
xtc.lang.cpp
SuperC is a configuration-preserving preprocessor and parser for C.
xtc.lang.jeannie
A compiler contributed to xtc that integrates Java with C.
xtc.parser
Rats!, a parser generator supporting extensible syntax.
xtc.tree
xtc's support for abstract syntax trees and for traversing them with visitors.
xtc.type
xtc's representation of types.
xtc.util
Utility classes for xtc.

xtc is a framework for building extensible source-to-source translators and compilers.

License

xtc is copyrighted in parts by Robert Grimm, New York University, Princeton University, and IBM; see each file's header for the relevant copyright notice. xtc also is open source software and released in parts under the GNU General Public License (GPL) version 2 and the GNU Lesser General Public License (LGPL) version 2.1, again as documented in each file's header.

Generally, most code in xtc is released under the GPL. However, most runtime classes for Rats!-generated parsers, including classes for representing AST nodes, are released under the LGPL. In detail, the classes released under the LGPL are:

  • ParserBase
  • Column
  • Result
  • SemanticValue
  • ParseError
  • ParseException
  • Location
  • Locatable
  • Node
  • Token
  • Annotation
  • Formatting
  • GNode
  • Action
  • EmptyIterator
  • Function
  • Pair
  • Runtime
  • SingletonIterator
  • State
  • SymbolTable
  • Tool
  • Utilities
To ensure that a Rats!-generated parser is compatible with the LGPL, invoke Rats! with the -lgpl command line argument.
